[Web]
Kim Kardashian, born Kimberly Noel Kardashian on October 21, 1980, in Los Angeles, California, is an American media personality, socialite, businesswoman, and actress. She first gained public attention as a friend and stylist to socialite Paris Hilton, but her fame skyrocketed in 2007 following the release of a sex tape featuring her and her then-boyfriend Ray J. This incident led to the launch of the reality television series "Keeping Up with the Kardashians," which debuted in October 2007 and ran until 2021. The show's success spawned several spin-offs and solidified Kardashian's status as a pop culture icon.

Kardashian has leveraged her fame into a successful business career, founding beauty and fragrance lines, including KKW Beauty and KKW Fragrance, as well as the shapewear company Skims, which was valued at over $4 billion as of 2023. She has also engaged in various entrepreneurial ventures, including her mobile game "Kim Kardashian: Hollywood," and authored books, including an autobiography with her sisters.

In addition to her business endeavors, Kardashian has pursued a career in acting, appearing in films like "Disaster Movie" (2008) and "Temptation: Confessions of a Marriage Counselor" (2013), as well as in voice roles for animated films such as "PAW Patrol." She has also become known for her political activism, particularly in prison reform, advocating for the release of nonviolent offenders and working alongside notable figures to influence criminal justice legislation.

Kardashian's personal life has been equally publicized; she was married to music producer Damon Thomas (2000-2004) and briefly to NBA player Kris Humphries in 2011, a marriage that lasted only 72 days. She was in a long-term relationship with rapper Kanye West from 2012 until their divorce in 2021, with whom she shares four children: North, Saint, Chicago, and Psalm. Kardashian has been recognized for her impact on popular culture, making Time magazine's list of the 100 most influential people and Fortune's list of the Most Powerful Women.

As of 2024, Kim Kardashian is estimated to have a net worth of approximately $1.7 billion, making her one of the wealthiest celebrities in the world. Through her extensive social media presence and various business ventures, she has exemplified the phenomenon of being "famous for being famous," while also engaging in philanthropic efforts and advocating for social justice issues.
